title: Question for all: Why do you love the champions you play?
body:
Let's get some positive thoughts in this forum. Despite all the calls for frustration and hatred around these parts, I think we should look back at why we play certain champions. Is it their mechanics? Their style? Their poise? Put some replies as to why below.

For me, I always did like playing Olaf, as he was my first main when I wanted to get serious into getting into ranked. He always had this 'fuck all' mentality to him to just run towards the carries guns ablazing. The results varied, but the immunity to CC was the largest middle finger towards those champs who relied on it.

replies.body:
karthus.

he's dead.

he wants you to be dead.

he sings a great melody

what's not to love?

Fun thread~

I like {{champion:107}} because nothing brings me greater satisfaction than the frantic prancing of an AD Carry when the exclamation point appears over their head. That and the raw, brutal, primal rage you get as you hear your preys heart throbbing during Thrill of the Hunt. It tunes everything else out and results in a 1 for 1 trade half the time because you can only focus on one thing: Taking the ADC's head. 

It also helps that I like to aggressively mash my keyboard while playing and Rengar is for sure a keyboard mashing champion.
thanks for the response novalas! lets hope the boards dont absolutely ravage you for this one

> [{quoted}](name=The Goodest Boy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jHMbXlpG,comment-id=00430000,timestamp=2018-10-29T23:57:59.149+0000)
>
> thanks for the response novalas! lets hope the boards doesnt absolutely ravage you for this one

I take great pride in eating squishy champions alive.

I main Zoe because I am a sadistic asshole who relishes in the pain of others because it makes me feel better about myself.

Also she`s pretty funny

Nasus, he feels so powerful and unstoppable and I love it. That feeling when pop Ult + Ghost on that bratty challenjour wannabe assassin that's been wrecking your team and delete that motherfucker's health bar by slamming a halberd into his skull that you've worked all game to strengthen while being merely tickled by his damage because your a towering motherfucking beast who doesn't give fucks.

> [{quoted}](name=Onandaga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jHMbXlpG,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-10-29T06:15:13.307+0000)
>
> Nasus, he feels so powerful and unstoppable and I love it. That feeling when pop Ult + Ghost on that bratty challenjour wannabe assassin that's been wrecking your team and delete that motherfucker's health bar by slamming a halberd into his skull that you've worked all game to strengthen while being merely tickled by his damage because your a towering motherfucking beast who doesn't give fucks.

Darius, to put folks like you in their place with an axe to the skull.

> [{quoted}](name=Reformedfindlay,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jHMbXlpG,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-10-30T15:18:30.949+0000)
>
> Darius, to put folks like you in their place with an axe to the skull.

It don't work like dat son. I've constantly dealt with folks who pick Darius into me as Nasus thinking they'll have an easy win only for them to get big dogged anyway. If you really want to give Nasus mains a hard time I would instead suggest picking up Singed or Anivia. Pure bullshit those two.

{{champion:76}} 

https://o.aolcdn.com/images/dims3/GLOB/legacy_thumbnail/630x315/format/jpg/quality/85/http%3A%2F%2Fi.huffpost.com%2Fgen%2F2377204%2Fimages%2Fn-COUGAR-CUB-628x314.jpg

Kled is a playable cartoon character. He has an amazing personality and a lot of energy, the guy he's mounting on makes it feel like you're actually riding on something (Even Riot said Sej could just be a really fat lady and it would change nothing), and it makes a guy like me, who typically enjoys a passive and peeling playstyle, ant to dive right in and just stab whatever I ran into.

I may be psychotic  deep down because of Kled, but I feel the best way to love a champ is to pretty much feel like you are them in a game.
kled reminds me of Yosemite Sam.

{{champion:22}} My main from Level 5 to Level 30.  I loved playing her, and she remains my favorite ADC.  Good lane, midgame spike, and strong scaling, with plenty of utility to help the team.  She’s also an inspiring leader and kindhearted, with a noble dream for the whole Freljord.

{{champion:163}} Where do I begin?  Her lore,  lines, gameplay, personality, surfing, throwing another rock, and riding a giant wall make her incredibly fun.  She’s also a true hero and a good person, with a real connection to the world in which she lives.  

{{champion:34}} “On my wings.”  Hearing that line for the first time made me shiver inside.  She watches over the Freljord, works with Ashe, and will keep it safe from the Watchers in the Howling abyss.  She is serene ever vigilant, wielding enormous power only to guard her home. 

{{champion:78}} She deserves that hammer.  She’s adorable, intrepid, humble, brave, funny, and has an earnest, stodgy forthrightness that is the very foundation of honor.  Also, plenty of crowd control, whomping, shield-chucking, and did I mention that hammer?
I LOVE anivia
^_^ Me too.
{{champion:103}}  because i have a chance of actually playing the game vs the assassin cancer
But ahri is an assasin :D

she didnt say ahri WASNT an assassin. you see; what better way to beat an assassin than to play a kite poke burst mage assassin with sustain and god tier mobility????? shes 4 steps ahead of all of us. ahri is assassin EVOLVED
Fight fire with better fire!
It's okay downvotes/upvotes are just numbers :)
why the hell did your message get downvoted??? the boards are wild

I love Juggernauts. Being this big buff warrior badass wielding an equally big and powerful weapon. The power fantasy of being able to shrug off blows ala the Juggernaut of X-Men Comics and pound the fools that dare to stand in your way just makes me happy, I guess.

My personal favourites and most played of them are in this order:

{{champion:86}} : Call down that glorious golden sword of Justice, you wonderful man you.

{{champion:122}} : How better to describe it than with one of his own quotes: "Defy Noxus, Taste your own blood."

{{champion:83}} : At least he gives you your last rites before bashing your head in with a shovel.

{{champion:6}} : Shotgun Legs. What more do I need to say?
{{champion:420}} :  I'm not big on sermons.  Broken bones teach better lessons!

I like Garen and Sona because I win.

I like Kled and Braum and Ornn for their VO. (And Xayah and Rakan, and Kindred, and Tahm, and Ivern and A.Sol and Bard too, and also Jhin, but I don't really play them.)

I like Fiora because she feels bad-ass. And Thresh too. And Leona a lil' bit. And let's not forget Jinx.

I like Illaoi and Urgot and Cho because theirs ults are satisfying (for different reasons, but same principle). And Annie isn't too bad either. Bonus point for Garen here too.

I like Trynda and Singed because split-pushing is fun and winning without fighting is the best way to tilt someone. (Yeah, I feel guilty for enjoying tilting others ^^' It's still fun, though.) (Again bonus point for Garen here. Yeah, I'm a Garen one-trick in Ranked, sue me.) And Jana too, she's great at tilting people.

I like Tanks because no matter what, you can still be useful. (Malph, Maokai, Sion, Nautilus, ...) 

I like Mundo because he does what he pleases. And Morde because he's cheesy.

I like a lot of fucking champs.... This game's a good game :)
{{champion:27}} I love trolling
Ekko because of DEM SICK OUTPLAYZ!

{{champion:86}} I love Demacia. He's rETardNeSs is funny. DEEEEEEMAAAAAAAAACIAAAAAAAA!!! Did I say I love Demacia?
{{champion:101}}  It's like playing a World of Tanks arty, but in LoL
{{champion:245}} Cool time-travelling lore, gadgets etc. R "whoops I fucked up"
{{champion:53}} "Beep Boop The time of man has come to an end". I go around acting like  a robot
{{champion:516}} "Pretty ironic when you are the one being fucked by a goat"
{{champion:78}} It's cute as fuck. 
{{champion:497}} It's HANDSOME as fuck (no homo btw, well, maybe only with him)
{{champion:133}} [initial D "gas gas gas" intensifies]
{{champion:44}} I swear I'm not homo...
{{champion:157}} I love Yasuo memes (0/10 power spike and HASAGI)
{{champion:54}} "I'm hard rock" and like MagicarpUsedFly said "Unstoppable Force, I'm sure there's a sex joke there" and there is: you build full AP, see adc, r click adc, "where he  go" adc. You buttfuck them so hard...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P4MJpOZTL_4 (watch till 1:20)

Not MalRUN
MalFIGHT

{{champion:4}} Twisted Fate:  his aesthetic is awesome and there's something about having a lot of control and range over engages, though his power is pretty weak for an early game champion now

{{champion:31}} chogath:  chogath exerts a lot of pressure on opponents without being overbearing.  He's a lane bully but has his own weaknesses to those he commonly encounters and he's a very versatile champion, able to play 4 out of 5 roles, which is quite a feat!

{{champion:420}} Illaoi:  she might be a bit overpowered, but with how many weaknesses her kit has, it's more than justified.  There's something about having that one moment and "wham!"  they're in for a world of hurt.  It also feels awesome to land those slow skill-shots and occasionally get a kill AFTER THE ENEMY IS SAFE  XD

{{champion:21}} :  I don't know about her new self.  It used to be a lot of fun to use her versatility to her advantage and change playstyles according to the opponent, even if it was basically the same method each game, that and that ultimate is like the ultimate party favor!

{{champion:26}}:  I'd say he's lower on this list, but come on, it's crazy fun to see the enemy running around like headless chickens trying to dodge your bombs.  it sometimes even gives you that unpleasant surprise when you put a bomb on an ally and they run away, thinking it was an enemy bomb XD

{{champion:82}} :  I used to love his **SHEER POWER AND THAT NO ONE WANTED TO PLAY HIM**  but after his update, I didn't like the changes.  I could probably adapt, but that three hit Q is just...well, boring.  Eh, maybe I should just turn him into a dragon ult bot XD  Too many gimmicks in a kit kind of ruins the charm... **and the power budget**

#I'm surprised I had so few champions that I consistently played that weren't just about their power

You've built illaoi full AD b4 right?
If not. You don't know the true meaning of "WHAM!!!!"

i've tried the three builds and overall, tank and bruiser are likely more effective just so you can survive your engage.  I'd have to check her AD ratio on her tentacle though

after looking, it's still impressive between 120% AD ;  then Q is 132% AD - 156% AD

I do love that her ult has the highest damage potential in the game though XD

Oh no doubt that her beefier builds are the best.
But that glorious 600+ AD E, chunking a cho gath down to under 10% of his HP...

it's so beautiful
well, it's not true damage, but yeah

I play Vladimir {{champion:8}} because when my enemy's{{champion:105}}  think i'm dead i get to throw up my mastery and see their health bars go from full to empty with pings of question marks of why i'm at full health from being in a pool on the ground with nothing left, from my team. their is nothing as satifying as an outplay like that and i get to do it almost every day{{item:3089}} {{item:3907}} {{item:3020}}
{{champion:119}}  because {{champion:119}}

I like two play two types of champions
1. Champions that deny other people fun
2. Champions that are control mages

1. because I am seriously depressed and nihilistic to the point of not really caring if I'm winning or not. As long as I can make other people suffer, I can actually feel something, whether its shame or sadistic pleasure or not.

2. I personally enjoy control mages but not as much as type 1 because I feel like I can change the flow of things quickly by being a mix between really supportive and really damagey, like a DnD wizard

{{champion:34}} {{champion:50}}{{champion:61}} {{champion:143}}
juggernauts are dope and I like being good at them

{{champion:122}} its the most satisfying thing every to chain Ult. Also as someone who hates losing to numbers instead of pure outplay this guy can take on multiple enemy champions at a time which I find awesome. Lastly I just love melee on melee brawls and this champion always gets into the thick of fights.

{{champion:86}} LUL 1k true dmg

{{champion:99}} Stay positive as I blow you up with my charging laser from 5 screens away, did I mention a double rainbow is a phenomenon of optics that displays a spectrum of light due to the sun shining on droplets of moisture in the atmosphere?  Cause yeah, that's a thing.  Ahahahahaaahaa!
Easily one of the most fun supports in the game, her shield is very powerful when you land both parts, her snare is a powerful catch tool, and her zoning and poke make for fun laning opportunities.  She's also one of few supports who has been consistently played outside of the support role to the point where a lot of people think she's not even a support, which is a nice inversion on the Brand and Zyra transition.

{{champion:55}} PENTAKILL
In all seriousness she has a far more complex kit than most would give her credit for, and her mini-game is rewarding when played right but also punishable and not overly difficult to counter so she's not too oppressive.  Her feast or famine game-play is fun especially since her rework which makes it so even when famining you can still do something while when feasting the enemy can still play around your main damage.

{{champion:81}} Is it to soon to call you honey?  It's too soon.
It's literally just those voice lines.  jk
His kit allows for a lot of varied playstyles, particularly the main divide between ap and ad Ezreal, his update made AP Ez far more viable especially in lane sustain which was a real problem with old Ezreal. 

{{champion:17}} ICH HEISSE SATAN!
His gameplay is really fun and is a good mixture of macro and micro play, his blind is a good mechanic and one of few that denies s Marksman's free auto attacks, conversely he is a marksman and is very toxic to fight.

"HIs blind is a good mechanic"

Please go back to hell where you belong

Well for starters. I love Jax. Im a pure jungle player and he was my first Jungler i learned. Kayn is great because hes a load of fun and Kha zix was the first champion I ever played back when I installed the game 2 years ago. 

I suffer from "too many mains" problem where i love every champion I own almost so i never take the time to get super good at a few XD.

{{champion:245}} 
Hands down best champ right there. I learned playing league through him and it was hard af in the beginnning but here I am sitting at 200k mastery points. He is the most fun champion for me to play and I love his personality. I think some people still underestimate his damage output and outplaying your opponent with Ekko is just so damn satisfying i love it. 

{{champion:98}} 
Shen is another champion I just LOVE. I only play him when I'm with my friends cuz he needs so much teamplay and communication. But there is nothing better than saving your AD Carry with your ult, getting that sweet 5 man taunt and peeling for your Carries. I 've never been the kind player who likes building tank or played for the team rather for himself but Shen changed that. 

Honorable metntions:
{{champion:497}}  Super fun + most inspiring positive personality
{{champion:84}}  She's op i know but I enjoy playing her and shes super cute ok
{{champion:202}}  The only AD Carry I really enjoy playing. Of all champs he probably has the best story and personality. Really something unique. And the way its implemented in his gameplay... Perfection
Swain's personality hits just a little bit close to home for me.

{{champion:59}} I recently picked him up, and his playstyle is a lot of fun. I’ve had some of my better recent jungle games with him. I love that, even if I’m behind and don’t have enough damage, if I can survive long enough for the flag-and-drag and ult, I can make a contribution to the fight.

{{champion:78}} / {{champion:57}} I’ve always enjoyed tanks, and having the ability to engage or change a fight in my team’s favor is incredibly satisfying to me.

{{champion:516}} one of my all-time favorites, although I preferred him much more around release. The idea that he was a low damage, high teamfight impact tank was incredibly satisfying to me, and timing that perfect ult with the old delay just felt amazing. That and blacksmithing was something I’ve had an interest in for some time. Edit: Even after the changes, I still enjoy the feeling of landing those abilities.

{{champion:161}} feeling like I’m using geometry to land those Q’s..

{{champion:114}} because I love the fact that she is the best duelist in the game if you play her right. My favorite feeling is when there is a fed enemy and they come to stop me from splitpushing and I beat them even though they were so ahead in gold. Nothing better than the sight of the enemy that thought he could beat you and gets stomped to the ground.

{{champion:24}} pretty much the same reason why I love Fiora, but he also has tankiness so I feel safer splitpushing as him. He also beats pretty much everyone, the difference is that people try to fight me way more often than when I play Fiora as if they forgot Jax's dueling potential.

{{champion:164}} because I love the moments when the enemy ADC/midlaner feels hopeless as I force them to fight even though they have no chance of winning.

{{champion:54}} 
Love that rock, love the lore about him, building full AP and smashing everyone when they try to do baron or dragon. BOOM!
I Main {{champion:142}} cause im just that type of person ;P{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
